name: CapabilityStatement
description: A Capability Statement documents a set of capabilities (behaviors) of a FHIR Server for a particular version of FHIR that may be used as a statement of actual server functionality or a statement of required or desired server implementation.

elements.name: id
elements.description: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

elements.name: meta
elements.description: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implicitRules
elements.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
elements.description: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: language
elements.description: The base language in which the resource is written.

binding.description: A human language.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: text
elements.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
elements.description: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contained
elements.description: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: url
elements.short: Canonical identifier for this capability statement, represented as a URI (globally unique)
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this capability statement when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier. This SHOULD be globally unique and SHOULD be a literal address at which at which an authoritative instance of this capability statement is (or will be) published. This URL can be the target of a canonical reference. It SHALL remain the same when the capability statement is stored on different servers.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.short: Business version of the capability statement
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the capability statement when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the capability statement author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions can be placed in a lexicographical sequence.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name for this capability statement (computer friendly)
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the capability statement. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: title
elements.short: Name for this capability statement (human friendly)
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the capability statement.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of this capability statement. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

binding.description: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: experimental
elements.short: For testing purposes, not real usage
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this capability statement is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: date
elements.description: The date  (and optionally time) when the capability statement was published. The date must change when the business version changes and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the capability statement changes.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: publisher
elements.short: Name of the publisher (organization or individual)
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the capability statement.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: contact
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.short: Natural language description of the capability statement
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the capability statement from a consumer's perspective. Typically, this is used when the capability statement describes a desired rather than an actual solution, for example as a formal expression of requirements as part of an RFP.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: useContext
elements.short: The context that the content is intended to support
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These contexts may be general categories (gender, age, ...) or may be references to specific programs (insurance plans, studies, ...) and may be used to assist with indexing and searching for appropriate capability statement instances.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.short: Intended jurisdiction for capability statement (if applicable)
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the capability statement is intended to be used.

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: purpose
elements.short: Why this capability statement is defined
elements.description: Explanation of why this capability statement is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: copyright
elements.description: A copyright statement relating to the capability statement and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the capability statement.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: kind
elements.description: The way that this statement is intended to be used, to describe an actual running instance of software, a particular product (kind, not instance of software) or a class of implementation (e.g. a desired purchase).

binding.description: How a capability statement is intended to be used.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: instantiates
elements.short: Canonical URL of another capability statement this implements
elements.description: Reference to a canonical URL of another CapabilityStatement that this software implements. This capability statement is a published API description that corresponds to a business service. The server may actually implement a subset of the capability statement it claims to implement, so the capability statement must specify the full capability details.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: imports
elements.short: Canonical URL of another capability statement this adds to
elements.description: Reference to a canonical URL of another CapabilityStatement that this software adds to. The capability statement automatically includes everything in the other statement, and it is not duplicated, though the server may repeat the same resources, interactions and operations to add additional details to them.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: software
elements.short: Software that is covered by this capability statement
elements.description: Software that is covered by this capability statement.  It is used when the capability statement describes the capabilities of a particular software version, independent of an installation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: name
elements.short: A name the software is known by
elements.description: Name the software is known by.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: version
elements.description: The version identifier for the software covered by this statement.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: releaseDate
elements.description: Date this version of the software was released.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implementation
elements.short: If this describes a specific instance
elements.description: Identifies a specific implementation instance that is described by the capability statement - i.e. a particular installation, rather than the capabilities of a software program.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: description
elements.description: Information about the specific installation that this capability statement relates to.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: url
elements.description: An absolute base URL for the implementation.  This forms the base for REST interfaces as well as the mailbox and document interfaces.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: custodian
elements.description: The organization responsible for the management of the instance and oversight of the data on the server at the specified URL.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: fhirVersion
elements.description: The version of the FHIR specification that this CapabilityStatement describes (which SHALL be the same as the FHIR version of the CapabilityStatement itself). There is no default value.

binding.description: All published FHIR Versions.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: format
elements.short: formats supported (xml | json | ttl | mime type)
elements.description: A list of the formats supported by this implementation using their content types.

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: patchFormat
elements.description: A list of the patch formats supported by this implementation using their content types.

binding.description: The mime type of an attachment. Any valid mime type is allowed.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: implementationGuide
elements.description: A list of implementation guides that the server does (or should) support in their entirety.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: rest
elements.short: If the endpoint is a RESTful one
elements.description: A definition of the restful capabilities of the solution, if any.

constraints.human: A given resource can only be described once per RESTful mode.

elements.name: mode
elements.description: Identifies whether this portion of the statement is describing the ability to initiate or receive restful operations.

binding.description: The mode of a RESTful capability statement.

elements.description: Information about the system's restful capabilities that apply across all applications, such as security.

elements.description: Server adds CORS headers when responding to requests - this enables Javascript applications to use the server.

elements.description: Types of security services that are supported/required by the system.

binding.description: Types of security services used with FHIR.

elements.description: General description of how security works.

elements.description: A specification of the restful capabilities of the solution for a specific resource type.

elements.name: type
elements.short: A resource type that is supported
elements.description: A type of resource exposed via the restful interface.

binding.description: One of the resource types defined as part of this version of FHIR.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: profile
elements.short: Base System profile for all uses of resource
elements.description: A specification of the profile that describes the solution's overall support for the resource, including any constraints on cardinality, bindings, lengths or other limitations. See further discussion in [Using Profiles](profiling.html#profile-uses).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: supportedProfile
elements.description: A list of profiles that represent different use cases supported by the system. For a server, "supported by the system" means the system hosts/produces a set of resources that are conformant to a particular profile, and allows clients that use its services to search using this profile and to find appropriate data. For a client, it means the system will search by this profile and process data according to the guidance implicit in the profile. See further discussion in [Using Profiles](profiling.html#profile-uses).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentation
elements.short: Additional information about the use of the resource type
elements.description: Additional information about the resource type used by the system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: interaction
elements.description: Identifies a restful operation supported by the solution.

elements.name: code
elements.short: read | vread | update | patch | delete | history-instance | history-type | create | search-type
elements.description: Coded identifier of the operation, supported by the system resource.

binding.description: Operations supported by REST at the type or instance level.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentation
elements.description: Guidance specific to the implementation of this operation, such as 'delete is a logical delete' or 'updates are only allowed with version id' or 'creates permitted from pre-authorized certificates only'.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: versioning
elements.description: This field is set to no-version to specify that the system does not support (server) or use (client) versioning for this resource type. If this has some other value, the server must at least correctly track and populate the versionId meta-property on resources. If the value is 'versioned-update', then the server supports all the versioning features, including using e-tags for version integrity in the API.

binding.description: How the system supports versioning for a resource.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: readHistory
elements.short: Whether vRead can return past versions
elements.description: A flag for whether the server is able to return past versions as part of the vRead operation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: updateCreate
elements.short: If update can commit to a new identity
elements.description: A flag to indicate that the server allows or needs to allow the client to create new identities on the server (that is, the client PUTs to a location where there is no existing resource). Allowing this operation means that the server allows the client to create new identities on the server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: conditionalCreate
elements.description: A flag that indicates that the server supports conditional create.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: conditionalRead
elements.description: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional read.

binding.description: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional read.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: conditionalUpdate
elements.description: A flag that indicates that the server supports conditional update.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: conditionalDelete
elements.short: not-supported | single | multiple - how conditional delete is supported
elements.description: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional delete.

binding.description: A code that indicates how the server supports conditional delete.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: referencePolicy
elements.description: A set of flags that defines how references are supported.

binding.description: A set of flags that defines how references are supported.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: searchInclude
elements.description: A list of _include values supported by the server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: searchRevInclude
elements.description: A list of _revinclude (reverse include) values supported by the server.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.description: The name of the search parameter used in the interface.

elements.name: definition
elements.description: An absolute URI that is a formal reference to where this parameter was first defined, so that a client can be confident of the meaning of the search parameter (a reference to [SearchParameter.url](searchparameter-definitions.html#SearchParameter.url)). This element SHALL be populated if the search parameter refers to a SearchParameter defined by the FHIR core specification or externally defined IGs.

elements.name: type
elements.short: number | date | string | token | reference | composite | quantity | uri | special
elements.description: The type of value a search parameter refers to, and how the content is interpreted.

binding.description: Data types allowed to be used for search parameters.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentation
elements.description: This allows documentation of any distinct behaviors about how the search parameter is used.  For example, text matching algorithms.

elements.name: name
elements.short: Name by which the operation/query is invoked
elements.description: The name of the operation or query. For an operation, this is the name  prefixed with $ and used in the URL. For a query, this is the name used in the _query parameter when the query is called.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: definition
elements.description: Where the formal definition can be found. If a server references the base definition of an Operation (i.e. from the specification itself such as ```http://hl7.org/fhir/OperationDefinition/ValueSet-expand```), that means it supports the full capabilities of the operation - e.g. both GET and POST invocation.  If it only supports a subset, it must define its own custom [OperationDefinition](operationdefinition.html#) with a 'base' of the original OperationDefinition.  The custom definition would describe the specific subset of functionality supported.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentation
elements.description: Documentation that describes anything special about the operation behavior, possibly detailing different behavior for system, type and instance-level invocation of the operation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: interaction
elements.description: A specification of restful operations supported by the system.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: id
elements.description: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

elements.name: extension
elements.description: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: modifierExtension
elements.short: Extensions that cannot be ignored even if unrecognized
elements.description:
May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element and that modifies the understanding of the element in which it is contained and/or the understanding of the containing element's descendants. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

Modifier extensions SHALL NOT change the meaning of any elements on Resource or DomainResource (including cannot change the meaning of modifierExtension itself).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

elements.name: code
elements.description: A coded identifier of the operation, supported by the system.

binding.description: Operations supported by REST at the system level.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentation
elements.description: Guidance specific to the implementation of this operation, such as limitations on the kind of transactions allowed, or information about system wide search is implemented.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: searchParam
elements.short: Search parameters for searching all resources
elements.description: Search parameters that are supported for searching all resources for implementations to support and/or make use of - either references to ones defined in the specification, or additional ones defined for/by the implementation.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: operation
elements.short: Definition of a system level operation
elements.description: Definition of an operation or a named query together with its parameters and their meaning and type.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: compartment
elements.description: An absolute URI which is a reference to the definition of a compartment that the system supports. The reference is to a CompartmentDefinition resource by its canonical URL .

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: messaging
elements.description: A description of the messaging capabilities of the solution.

elements.name: protocol
elements.description: A list of the messaging transport protocol(s) identifiers, supported by this endpoint.

binding.description: The protocol used for message transport.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: address
elements.short: Network address or identifier of the end-point
elements.description: The network address of the endpoint. For solutions that do not use network addresses for routing, it can be just an identifier.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: reliableCache
elements.description: Length if the receiver's reliable messaging cache in minutes (if a receiver) or how long the cache length on the receiver should be (if a sender).

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: documentation
elements.description: Documentation about the system's messaging capabilities for this endpoint not otherwise documented by the capability statement.  For example, the process for becoming an authorized messaging exchange partner.

constraints.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

elements.name: supportedMessage
elements.description: References to message definitions for messages this system can send or receive.
